data.event: The Casa Blanca or White House was part of a settlement established at the site around 1754 by Tomás Sánchez de la Barrera y Gallardo, captain of Laredo, who was ordered to find a suitable site for a new settlement.

event.title: granted the land to Juan José de la Garza Montemayor and his sons Agustín, Perfecto, and Manuel on April 2, 1807

data.event: The Spanish crown granted the land to Juan José de la Garza Montemayor and his sons Agustín, Perfecto, and Manuel on April 2, 1807.

event.title: was occupied by their heirs until 1852

data.event: According to records the land was occupied by their heirs until 1852.
In 1876 the land was purchased by John L. Wade.
In 1893, the post office was reactivated.

event.title: did not prosper, however, and by 1914

data.event: Wade City did not prosper, however, and by 1914 its population had decreased to thirty-five.
The post office ceased operation in 1922.
